title: Create a deployment with image nginx:1.18.0, called nginx, having 2 replicas, defining port 80 as the port that this container exposes (don't create a service for this deployment)
description: Create a deployment with image nginx:1.18.0, called nginx, having 2 replicas, defining port 80 as the port that this container exposes (don't create a service for this deployment)

steps: 1. kubectl create deployment nginx  --image=nginx:1.18.0  --dry-run=client -o yaml > deploy.yaml

4. kubectl create deployment nginx  --image=nginx:1.18.0  --dry-run=client -o yaml | sed 's/replicas: 1/replicas: 2/g'  | sed 's/image: nginx:1.18.0/image: nginx:1.18.0\n        ports:\n        - containerPort: 80/g' | kubectl apply -f -
